title: The version number on master (1.12.1) is behind the one on R1_12_maintenance (1.12.2)
body:
## Description

Forked project to make a change and resulted build is at 1.12.1 instead of the official 1.12.2 that seems to originate from branch R1_12_maintenance that is not the master and seems to be behind.

title: NA
body: `master` needs to be bumped to 1.13.0

title: NA

title: Remove the dependency on the deprecated ICU4J/com.ibm.icu
body:
ICU4J is being removed from the platform, see [Bugzilla #562582](https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=562582).

The Eclipse [Plug-In Migration Guide](https://help.eclipse.org/latest/topic/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv/porting/4.16/recommended.html?cp=2_3_7_3) mentions:

>  Description: Callers of classes in com.ibm.icu.* package are advised to migrate to respective classes in java.text or java.util packages.

> Action required: If your bundle has a Require-Bundle: com.ibm.icu or Import-Package: com.ibm.icu.*, remove it. Fix the resulting compilation errors in java files by replacing the com.ibm.icu.* imports with imports of respective classes from java.text or java.util as documented in the ICU4J class being replaced. See Bug 562582. 

EMF Validation has several uses of classes from `com.ibm.icu` in the core plug-in.

title: NA
body: Fixed by 838181ba321ff8ec0b0440c81b97bebd5e4dd07b

title: Drop support for Eclipse versions more than about 2 years old
body:
This is to reduce the maintenance burden in a world where Eclipse, Tycho and Java move faster.
Given that the project is in maintenance mode, users who are stuck on older versions of Eclipse/Java can stay on the corresponding versions of EMF Validation without functional loss.

title: NA
body: Fixed by 9c3dae2 (and the appropriate changes in [the Jenkins jobs](https://ci.eclipse.org/emfservices/view/emf-validation/)).

title: Move BREE to JavaSE-11
body: Once #5 is done, the oldest version of Eclipse supported will require Java 11, so we can move to that as BREE and simplify the builds by not having to cater for Java 8.

title: Revert to Tycho 2.7.2 for 2022-09
body:
Version 1.13.1 [moved to Tycho 2.7.4](https://github.com/eclipse/emf-validation/compare/R1_13_0...R1_13_1), which changed its behavior (see https://github.com/eclipse-tycho/tycho/issues/1281). The 1.13.1 repository has quite a lot of unexpected stuff which was not included before.
Compare [1.13.1](https://download.eclipse.org/justj/?file=modeling/emf/validation/updates/releases/R202208151538/plugins) to [1.13.0](https://download.eclipse.org/justj/?file=modeling/emf/validation/updates/releases/R202208101528/plugins).

I'll rebuild using a previous version of Tycho and release 1.13.2 before 2022-09 to reduce the impacts on the SimRel.

title: Seriously Out of date OCL Validation example
body:
* üÜî Bugzilla ID: [#327956](https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=327956)
* üìò Project: Modeling / EMF Services / Validation
* üóì Created: 2010-10-15T20:38:45Z
* ‚ùì Status: NEW /

title: NA
body:
_[Comment #0 on Fri Oct 15 2010 22:38:45 GMT+0200 (Central European Summer Time)](https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=327956#c0):_
```
The Developers's Guide continues to encourage the use of OCL embedded in XML CDATA sections. This was necessary with Eclipse 3.2.

Eclipse 3.3, MDT/OCL 1.1 introduced EMF codegen for OCL from EAnnotations that could be maintained within the Sample Ecore Editor, and could be activated from the generated Java model.

Eclipse 3.6, EMF 2.6 introduced validation delegates which MDT/OCL 3.0 exploited to again support OCL in EAnnotations, support activation from Java models, or dynmamic activation via eInvoke.

It is not clear that the oruginal approaches still work. It is certainly unhelpful to describe them without accompanying warnings and pointers to new approaches.

A redirection to http://127.0.0.1:49350/help/topic/org.eclipse.ocl.doc/tutorials/oclinecore/oclInEcoreTutorial.html would be helpful.
```

---

title: Support Eclipse 2023-03
body:
This is about making sure a version of EMF Validation compatible with Eclipse 2023-03 is contributed in the SimRel.
It might be as simple as just checking the current version is OK, or require some adaptations (e.g. regarding APIs deprecated or removed from the platform).

title: NA
body: Build and tests are green on the 2023-03 target platform.

title: Support Eclipse 2023-06
body:
The Eclipse platform has moved to Java 17 and recently removed quite a lot of APIs which were deprecated.
This is about making sure EMF Validation works properly with the upcoming Eclipse 4.28 (2023-06).

title: Regenerate validation.ecore with more "modern" parameters
body: At least try to use `MinimalEObjectImpl`, and maybe enable some other EMF features that did not exist in 2009 (e.g. child extenders, style providers, etc.).

title: Drop support for Eclipse versions older than 2022-09 and switch to Java 17
body:
Eclipse 2022-09 (version 4.25 of the platform) is the first version which _requires_ Java 17.
In order to reduce the maintenance burden, EMF Validation will drop support for older versions of Eclipse, and require Java 17.

For people who still need to use EMF Validation with older versions of Eclipse and/or Java, the older releases still work exactly as before, and given that there is only the occasional bugfix, they are functionally equivalent.

title: Remove the explicit source features
body:
With modern versions of Tycho & PDE it seems that there is no real need to define them explicitly.
See https://www.eclipse.org/lists/cross-project-issues-dev/msg19553.html

title: NA
body:
This change did a bit too much.

It's not necessary to **define** the feature manually - letting Tycho's `feature-source` do that is fine, but the auto-generated feature still has to be put in the repository.

The changes to [releng/org.eclipse.emf.validation.repository/category.xml](https://github.com/eclipse-emfservices/emf-validation/commit/b0a3e9e9e8a4fdcdb95c8c62b28096d9dac6f698#diff-deab37c4fc82c6e9c7e1f88a40240bc1aca2efaf775d5fb31e246bc47a3a2d90) should be reverted.

title: NA
body:
My reading from [the message on cross-project](https://www.eclipse.org/lists/cross-project-issues-dev/msg19553.html) was that source *bundles* are enough, as in the end only bundles have actual meaningful sources, and whichever way they (the bundles) are made available in the build or development environment, their corresponding source bundle, if available, will be found/resolved.

> the idea is to get rid of source features.
> [...]
> source features are not so important artifacts per se, what really matters is making source bundles available [...] nowadays, none of those do require source features
> [...]
> you may be able to get rid of source features 

What am I missing? What did this break? (the simrel build is fine)

title: NA
body: I have no issue with re-introducing them (see the new PR), but I'd like to understand why they are needed.

title: NA
body:
Well it depends on the way the features are modeled and what you want to provide.

1. You could have the individual bundles only and not include them in any feature
2. You could include the source bundles in your `.sdk` feature
3. You could ship a dedicated `.source` feature collecting all the source bundles

The issue is in 1.13.0 option 3 was chosen, so removing them was simply a breaking change for consumers of that `.source` feature. E.g, we were/are including them in our `.target` definition for our product and this suddenly broke with Eclipse SimRel 2024-09 M3 containing EMF services 1.14.0 RC1.

Therefore, for compatibility, the feature should be kept published on the update site.

title: Adopt JustJ's publisher application for promotion
body:
See https://eclipse.dev/justj/?page=tools

It was recently added (by Ed himself) to Graphiti, [this comment](https://gitlab.eclipse.org/eclipse/graphiti/graphiti/-/issues/3#note_1394460) looks like a good reference for what's involved.

title: Add any missing top-level files
body:
Review and add (or update) the various recommended top-level files.
See https://gitlab.eclipse.org/eclipsefdn/emo-team/emo/-/issues/591#legal-documentation for example for a list of what the EF expects.

title: Ensure compatibility with upcoming OCL
body:
OCL has recently introduced [a change](https://git.eclipse.org/c/ocl/org.eclipse.ocl.git/diff/plugins/org.eclipse.ocl/src/org/eclipse/ocl/OCL.java?id=b13265da499a26dfdb8c1bfdd39de9ddcd2d89d0) which removes the `OCL.newInstance()` static methods (see https://www.eclipse.org/lists/cross-project-issues-dev/msg19930.html and https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=416470#c16).

EMF Validation is impacted in `AbstractOCLModelConstraint`.

title: NA
body:
The easy fix is to replace `OCL.newInstance()` with `OCL.newInstanceAbstract()`, but that new method only exists in the (yet to be released) OCL 6.22, so this would mean the corresponding EMF Validation version would stop being compatible with earlier versions of OCL.

The only way I see to stay compatible with both versions is to use ugly reflective code to find out which method to invoke at runtime.

title: Add support for SBOM generation
body:
* Tycho documentation: https://github.com/eclipse-tycho/tycho/blob/main/RELEASE_NOTES.md#support-for-cyclonedx-maven-plugin
* [Support backported to Tycho 4.0.6](https://github.com/eclipse-tycho/tycho/blob/tycho-4.0.10/RELEASE_NOTES.md#406)
* Upstream CycloneDX Maven Plugin: https://github.com/CycloneDX/cyclonedx-maven-plugin
